projectPurpose: To provide developers with practical code examples in Rust for building and running MEV searcher bots that interact with Jito Labs' specialized infrastructure on the Solana blockchain, demonstrating features like transaction bundling and private submission.
mainFeatures: Provides Rust code examples for Jito Block Engine interaction
Demonstrates building and submitting Jito transaction bundles
Includes a CLI tool for exploring Jito searcher functionality
Shows how to work with protobufs for Jito API communication

alternatives.name: Solana-rs
mainFeatures: Client for Solana RPC and websockets

alternatives.name: Other MEV Infrastructure Providers (e.g., Paladin, BloxRoute - on other chains)

mostWellKnownAlternative: Solana Web3.js (for general Solana development); Jito (for Solana MEV infrastructure)
marketPositioning: Searcher-examples is positioned not as a direct competitor to general Solana development SDKs (like solana-web3.js or solana-rs), but as a supplementary, essential resource for developers specifically targeting MEV strategies on the Solana network using Jito Labs' specialized infrastructure. It serves as the primary code example kit for onboarding developers to the Jito Block Engine and Relayer, highlighting Jito's unique features like atomic transaction bundling and private transaction submission as the preferred method for sophisticated MEV searchers on Solana.
